structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.catch_line: Consent to autopsy when death not a coroner's case.
law.text: In the event the death of a person is not a coroner's case, consent to an autopsy shall be obtained from the decedent, by written consent, signed and acknowledged prior to his death; or his or her spouse; or in the absence of a spouse, the next of kin of the decedent; or in the absence of any of the above, the person who assumes the responsibility to dispose of the body.
law.history: Created 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 93, sec. 9, effective June 17, 1978.
